metadata.synopsis: The Emperor tries to get you to help it destroy Orpheus' royal guard so that it can subdue Orpheus again. If you side with the Emperor, you fight against the githyanki with the help of the Emperor and the intellect devourers. If you side with the githyanki, the Emperor feels betrayed and will teleport you back to the material plane where you have a few turns to get back inside the portal and some githyanki to kill on your way.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Go near the Emperor in the Astral Plane during Intermezzo

4.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player, being physically in the Astral plane, enters a full-blown battle. Before us, 4 of Orpheus' guards fight against a mind flayer, The Emperor/Daisy.

The Emperor holds his hands up, they are buzzing with psionic energy. He is trying to recreate the globe of domination with one hand, and uses telekenis with the other to fling a stone toward the guards.

One of the guards kicks the stone to the side, following through to knock the Emperor down toward the player.

65.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The globe stops forming.

At the centre, Orpheus is chained (with VFX lightning chains) to a rock by the infernal shackles he wears, unmoving, his eyes rolled back to the whites (or equivalent cool VFX suggesting he is subdued.) His head is also snapped back so that he looks unseeing at the sky.

76.context: CinematicNodeContext: Intellect devourers swarm the guards, and the battle moves away from the player and Emperor.

15.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the absence of the globe of domination we see the chains that bind Orpheus stop glowing. Orpheus’ head straightens to its natural position as he ‘awakens’. A closeup on Orpheus’ face as his eyes roll back to their natural state. He is ‘free’ of the Emperor’s psionic control (though still unable to move.)

25.speaker: The Emperor
25.text: Before you do anything - I am your ally.
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: From the ground, the Emperor locks eyes with us and speaks.

9.speaker: Jaheira
9.text: You are in danger indeed, mind flayer. What the hells is happening?

19.speaker: The Emperor
19.text: The githyanki is the source of our protection against the Absolute. I MUST subdue him or everything we've worked towards is lost.
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Orpheus. His eyes lock on us.

26.speaker: The Emperor
26.text: Don't let my form deceive you. I am the one that's been protecting you. I am the one that came to you in your dreams.
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Emperor getting to his feet.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: What do you need me to do?

27.speaker: The Emperor
27.text: The honour guard - eliminate them. My forces are weakened by their assault. But with your help, we can turn this around.

38.speaker: The Emperor
38.text: Destroy the guard. I will subdue their master.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I want no part in the slaughter of my kin.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I'm not helping a mind flayer.

84.speaker: The Emperor
84.text: You do not understand. He will attack anyone that reeks of illithid - that includes YOU.

0.speaker: The Emperor
0.text: And you will not even be able to defend yourself. If you kill him, the Absolute will enthral you.

49.speaker: The Emperor
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor pins its gaze on us, a mix of fear and anger.

53.speaker: The Emperor
53.text: I AM THE REASON YOU ARE FREE.

14.speaker: The Emperor
14.text: We are more alike than you want to admit. Look past it. I know you don't want to, but you must.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Prove to me that you are who you say.

71.speaker: The Emperor
71.text: You saved a child from a viper, back in the druids' grove.

36.speaker: The Emperor
36.text: You slept with the drow Minthara. You pleased her.

87.speaker: The Emperor
87.text: You killed the aasimar Nightsong. You didn't have to.

81.speaker: The Emperor
81.text: You saved the aasimar Nightsong from her soul cage.

55.speaker: The Emperor
55.text: The last time you were here, you tried to kill me. Not far from this very spot.

33.speaker: The Emperor
33.text: You let me live, last time you were here. Though it brought Vlaakith's wrath upon you.

17.speaker: The Emperor
17.text: I told you about my room in the Elfsong Tavern, that night when you held me. I was vulnerable - you comforted me.

75.speaker: The Emperor
75.text: Your continued existence as yourself and not a mind flayer should be all the proof you need.

39.speaker: The Emperor
39.text: You shared an intimate night with the drow, Minthara.

72.speaker: The Emperor
72.text: Do NOT be driven by fear! Trust me now and I promise you will have all the answers you seek.

60.speaker: The Emperor
60.text: The guard. Destroy the guard. They prevent me from subduing their master.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Try to read the mind flayer's thoughts.

3.speaker: Narrator
3.text: *Despite your best attempts to be subtle, the mind flayer's awareness is everywhere. You blunder in its presence like a worg pup learning to walk.*

11.speaker: The Emperor
11.text: You must be joking. I am TELLING you my thoughts. Directly. Into. Your. Head.

85.speaker: The Emperor
85.text: But if you insist on taking a look for yourself, BE MY GUEST.

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *Nothing in your colourful existence to date could have prepared you for this.*
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor closes his eyes. The player enter a mindmeld with them. The connection is held briefly then they drop to one knee, mentally overwhlemed.

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *As the horror subsides, you are left with only one coherent thought - you must do whatever you can to subdue the githyanki.*
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see the player reeling as the mindmeld ends before they get back to their feet, woozily.

90.speaker: Lae'zel
90.text: Aid an illithid against githyanki? We cannot, we must not!

79.speaker: The Emperor
79.text: Your blind loyalty will be your undoing, Lae'zel. Fight with me. For your own survival.

12.speaker: The Emperor
12.text: Together we can turn the tide.

45.speaker: The Emperor
45.text: FOOL. Without me you will perish!

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I will not betray my people!

54.speaker: The Emperor
54.text: Then you would betray yourself and all your allies? Without me you will perish!

32.speaker: The Emperor
32.text: That was awful. Just awful. You haven't even IMPROVED since your last attempt!

69.speaker: The Emperor
69.text: You must be joking. Look around you - we are at WAR.

58.speaker: The Emperor
58.text: Fight with me. Your future depends on it!

16.speaker: Player
16.text: This is the battle you were fighting?

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I don't believe you. You're a mind flayer.

47.speaker: Lae'zel
47.text: Ghaik abomination! By the One True Sky, what is this madness?

68.speaker: Shadowheart
68.text: A mind flayer? What's going on here?!

78.speaker: Gale
78.text: A mind flayer? What the blazes is going on here?

89.speaker: Astarion
89.text: Another tentacled freak? What in the hells is this?

91.speaker: Halsin
91.text: A mind flayer? What foul trickery is this?

59.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
59.text: Explain yourself, illithid, or we will end you.
59.context: NodeContext: unnerved but in control as the party encounter an illlithid that claims to be their ally - situation is tense and urgent

88.speaker: The Emperor
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor is really struggling now that we have attacked him.

63.speaker: The Emperor
63.text: I should have known. This wasn't the first time you tried to kill me.

70.speaker: The Emperor
70.text: But without me, you will perish!
